content: Geysers are one type of hydrothermal vents. They gush hot water from deep underground. Oceanographers found hydrothermal vents at the bottom of the ocean gushing hot water at more than 400 ºC.

A vent site in the Cayman Trough named Beebe, which is the world's deepest known hydrothermal site at ~5,000 m (16,000 ft) below sea level, has shown sustained supercritical venting at 401 ºC (754 ºF) and 2.3 wt% NaCl.
heading: Hydrothermal Vents
